review: The Amazon Fire TV is all that I expected and exceeded some of my expectations. The clarity of the picture is very good on my LCD TV. I bought the Fire TV just before the holidays and became very busy doing the shopping, feasting and other things that take up time during the last quarter of the year. I have two projectors and 14 foot screens and mainly bought the Fire TV to hook up to them. I ordered the digital sound cable to hook up the sound from the Fire TV to my amp. It arrived yesterday and I plan on hooking it up this weekend. If the picture clarity is anything like I get on the LCD TV, I will be very happy with it. The Fire TV loads quickly and I have not had any problems with streaming it. I also have a Roku II and it has worked ok for streaming the video, it does require subscription services from providers and I have some problems with the movies freezing while it picks up the stream from time to time. I have shown the Fire to several of my friends and touted the benefits of owning it over other brands available, which has peeked their interest in getting one for themselves. I will add more information on my experiences with the projectors when I get the time to play with them. I'm sure there are many projector owners interested in the Fire TV that would like to hook it up. The only problem I see now is that I will have to keep unhooking the Fire from the TV which is just below my projection screen in order to hook it up to the projector which is across the room. I wish there were apps for the news shows that are on Cable TV (Fox and CNN etc.) so that I could cancel my cable company, which I guess I can steam from one of my tablets or lap tops to the TV if I get the time to mess with that.
